intro: Sisymbrium weddellii, commonly known as Weddell's mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and have a peppery aroma when crushed. The seeds are small and are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some regions.
